title: Definitions
context: ยง327K-1 Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of health. &ldquo;Form&rdquo; means a provider orders for life-sustaining treatment form adopted by the department. &ldquo;Health care provider&rdquo; means an individual licensed, certified, or otherwise authorized or permitted by law to provide health care in the ordinary course of the individual&rsquo;s business or profession. &ldquo;Legally authorized representative&rdquo; means an agent, guardian, or surrogate, as those terms are defined in section 327E-2, or agent designated through a power of attorney for health care, as defined in section 327E-2. &ldquo;Patient&rsquo;s provider&rdquo; means a physician licensed pursuant to chapter 453 or an advanced practice registered nurse licensed pursuant to chapter 457 who has examined the patient. &ldquo;Provider orders for life-sustaining treatment form&rdquo; means a form signed by a patient, or if incapacitated, by the patient&rsquo;s legally authorized representative and the patient&rsquo;s provider, that records the patient&rsquo;s wishes and that directs a health care provider regarding the provision of resuscitative and life-sustaining measures. A provider orders for life-sustaining treatment form is not an advance health-care directive. [L 2009, c 186, pt of ยง1; am L 2014, c 154, ยง3; am L 2015, c 35, ยง43]
